intro: Malvastrum subtriflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a soft, fuzzy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
